page.title: 08WOLSTON FIRST SCHOOL
page.content: Wolston St. Margaret's First School provides{education}in two buildings, the oldest situated in School Street is called the Annexe. Outside toilets are still in use and separate a grassy area from the tarmac playground. The{ {building}has been modernised with lowered ceiling and oilfired central heating. Nearly .4 of a mile away, is the new building called Brookside the first phase of which was opened in 1970. In 1974 a{nursery}class was included but this meant a temporary classroom unit being sited on the playing field. The second phase is still to be finished and campaigning continues for a completion date. The children wear a {school uniform}which is red, white and grey and there is a special striped school tie and a badge with St. Margaret's cross and the dragon on it.
